cloudformation-stack.desc: A stack is a collection of AWS resources that you can manage as a single unit.

codebuild-job-run.desc: Codebuild job run, it is not a batch job run.

codebuild-project.desc: A build project includes information about how to run a build.

codecommit-repository.desc: A repository is where you store code and files for your project.

codepipeline-pipeline.desc: Code pipeline is a workflow construct that describes how software changes go through a release process.

dynamodb-table.desc: A table is a collection of data.

ec2-instance.desc: An EC2 instance is simply a virtual server in AWS

ec2-security-group.desc: A security group acts as a firewall that controls the traffic allowed to and from the resources in your VPC.

ec2-subnet.desc: A subnet is a range of IP addresses in your VPC.

ec2-vpc.desc: A virtual private cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account.

ecr-repository.desc: AWS managed container image registry service that is secure, scalable, and reliable.

ecr-repository-image.desc: An container image in ECR repository.

ecs-cluster.desc: An Amazon ECS cluster is a logical grouping of tasks or services.

ecs-task-run.desc: A task run is the instantiation of a task definition within a cluster.

ecs_task_definition_family.desc: A name of the task definition, without revision id.

iam-group.desc: An IAM user group is a collection of IAM users.

iam-policy.desc: IAM policies define permissions for an action regardless of the method that you use to perform the operation.

iam-role.desc: An IAM role is an IAM identity that you can create in your account that has specific permissions.

iam-user.desc: IAM user is an entity that you create in AWS.

lambda-function.desc: A function is a resource that you can invoke to run your code in Lambda.

lambda-function-alias.desc: A Lambda alias is a pointer to a function version that you can update.

lambda-layer.desc: A Lambda layer is a .zip file archive that can contain additional code or other content.

s3-bucket.desc: A bucket is a container for objects.

sfn-state-machine-execution.desc: A execution of a state machine.
